definition: willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in

sentences.english: One on offer . In India the poor, proportionately, are more likely to vote.
sentences.chinese: 按比例來說，印度的窮人比中產階級更樂於參加投票。

sentences.english: The first man's neighbours were unhelpful.
sentences.chinese: 第一個男人的鄰居不樂於助人。

sentences.english: Reggina striker Rolando Bianchi has welcomed interest from Lazio.
sentences.chinese: 雷吉納的比安奇表示樂於接受來自拉齊奧邀請。

sentences.english: We all admire his readiness to help others.
sentences.chinese: 我們都佩服他樂於助人的精神。

sentences.english: Pigs are born to give, to yield and to serve.
sentences.chinese: 屬豬者天生樂於付出，謙讓，爲他人效勞。

sentences.english: Those who are recl posty to help others have responsibility .
sentences.chinese: 樂於助人的人有責任心。

sentences.english: Our senses are more acute. We are more open to new experiences.
sentences.chinese: 感官變得更靈敏，更樂於接受新體驗。
他只是一個樂於拍馬屁的人。

sentences.english: I will be happy to seed the discussion with a few topics.
sentences.chinese: 我將非常樂於用幾個主題爲該討論埋下伏筆。

sentences.english: Those are Asian values to which Banyan will happily subscribe
sentences.chinese: 這些都是榕樹樂於贊同亞洲的價值觀。

sentences.english: My aunt Kik was beautiful, lively, and giving.
sentences.chinese: 我的姑姑凱瑟琳活潑美麗，是個樂於奉獻的人。

sentences.english: They liked to listen to my intruction about the garden and my little plot.
sentences.chinese: 他們樂於聽我講解我們的花園和我的小菜地。

sentences.english: Many birds are happy to feed on the ground, eliminating the need for any feeder at all.
sentences.chinese: 很多鳥樂於在地上覓食，完全省了任何飼餌臺。

sentences.english: Lei Feng is always ready to help people.
I love learning about the business and finding ways that I can contribute to its success.
sentences.chinese: 我樂於瞭解業務並想辦法促其成功。

sentences.english: Yeah. He's always ready to help and gives a leg-up in critical time.
sentences.chinese: 是埃他總是樂於助人，常常在關鍵時刻助人一臂之力。

definition: to be willing to do sth/to be ready to do sth/to be happy to do sth/content/satisfied
to be capable of/to be able to/can
to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
